subSubSection.paragraph:
Malacosoma castrensis
v. kirghisica Staudinger, 1879 , Stett. Ent. Ztg. 40 : 318 . TL: Narün, nordöstlich von Astrachan zwischen Wolga- und Ural-Fluâ, etwa 15 deutsche Meilen ostwärts von der Wolga.
Distribution (Map 11 ): widely distributed in Europe and Caucasus to far eastern Russia , China , Central Asia
and Asia Minor . - In Iran : West Azerbaijan , East Azerbaijan , Ardebil, Guilan, Mazandaran, Tehran, Semnan,
Qazvin, Kordestan, Zanjan, Qom, Markazi, Esfahan, Lorestan, Chaharmahal va Bakhtiari, Kohkiluyeh va
Boyerahmad, Fars , Hormozgan and Sistan va Balouchestan provinces.

Bionomics . The species is univoltine throughout its range. Flight period July to August. Inhabits lowlands to mid altitudes in Iran from 1700 to 3000 m ; more typical of arid biotopes and lowlands. Larvae are polyphagous and recorded from
Artemisia
sp. ( Asteraceae ),
Geranium
spp . ( Geraniaceae ),
Euphorbia
spp . ( Euphorbiaceae ),
Atraphaxis spinosa
( Polygonaceae ). Pupation in silky cocoon with yellowish powder, on the food plants and under stones. Eggs hibernate. The manuscript name "farsi" was introduced by O. Bang-Haas (in litt.; "TL:" Iran , Fars , Strasse Chiraz-Kazeroun, Fort Sine-Sefid, ca. 2200 m ) to designate syntypes in many European museums but the name was never validly published.
